{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question asks about the appropriate treatment for an 11-year-old boy with spacing between maxillary incisors. The relevant document is 'Maxillary diastema: indications for treatment'. According to this document, a clinician must analyze the individual case in order to determine whether the diastema is to close through normal development or if there exists a likelihood of its persistence. Since the patient is only 11 years old and still growing, it is likely that the diastema will persist unless treated. Therefore, treatment is necessary.", "answer_choice": C}
